ETYMOLOGY: From Latin *constructio* (stem *construction-*) 'a building', from *constructus*, past participle of *construere* 'to build together', from *com-* 'together' + *struere* 'to pile, build'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The action or process of building something, typically a large structure.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 建造某物（通常是大型结构）的行为或过程。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The construction of the new bridge will take several years.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新桥的建设将耗时数年。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A building, structure, or object that has been built or constructed.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 已建造或构建的建筑物、结构或物体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The tower is a remarkable construction of glass and steel.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这座塔是玻璃和钢铁的杰出建筑。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The way in which something is built or made; its arrangement or composition.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某物的建造或制造方式；其排列或构成。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The careful construction of the argument made it very persuasive.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 论点的精心构建使其非常有说服力。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: put a construction on [sth] | the construction of [sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An interpretation or explanation of a statement, event, or action.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对陈述、事件或行动的解释或说明。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He placed a positive construction on the otherwise ambiguous remarks.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他对这些模棱两可的言论做出了积极的解释。

REGISTER: General usage, often in technical or formal contexts, especially for meanings related to building and interpretation.
